definitions.definition: Ill will or hatred toward another, accompanied with the desire to unjustifiably irritate , annoy , or thwart ; a want to disturb or put out another; mild malice
examples: He was so filled with spite for his ex-wife, his brother was afraid of what he might do.
They did it just for spite .

main_definition: Ill will or hatred toward another, accompanied with the desire to unjustifiably irritate , annoy , or thwart ; a want to disturb or put out another; mild malice
